Completely hysterical, you take to your heels and sprint into the distance as quickly as you can. Your deadly terror lets you reach a breath-taking speed, as you pass plenty of tall trees and bushes. Without turning back, you keep on running, noticing the tree density rising dramatically. Damn! It seems like you run deeper into the forest instead of reaching any signs of civilization. The solid ground underneath you slowly turns into a soft, muddy surface with every step you take. But you don't dare to stop now, for the giant creature might still be chasing you. After some seconds you reach some towering reeds, and frantically push them aside to fit through. However, a negligent move causes you to stumble over a hard rock, dropping right into a pit of soft, moist dirt. This wasn't ordinary soil, but the marshy ground of a swamp!

Landing on all fours, you attempt to crawl back to safety, only to realize there was no firm ground nearby. Moreover, your hands and feet begin to sink into the mud, locking you in your position. Your distressed struggling only speeds up the process, and soon your elbows and knees vanish into the mushy death trap. "Help! Please, somebody help me!" You scream at the top of your lungs. But being honest with yourself, this situation seems utterly hopeless. No human soul is around, and you can't find the strength to help yourself. A tear runs down your cheek. Your shouting continues; no words, merely the last death screams of a fool who ran blindly into his doom. Your face touches the mud, slowly being sucked into it. Expecting to be buried in a few seconds, you prepare for your last moments.

All of a sudden, you feel two giant fingers digging into the soil next to you, swiftly grabbing your torso. With a jolt, you're pulled out of the sludge and lifted up into the air. Gasping for air, you remove the dirt from your eyes and try to identify the huge creature that saved your life.

It is...
11131.title: Trapped in the Swamp

111311.content:
Still petrified by your near-death-experience, you stare at the big, blue hand, holding you in dangerous heights. The next moment, the creature gently lets you slip into its huge palm and even lifts you up further. Your view wanders from the creature's light blue torso up towards its face, where your eyes finally meet. Instantly, you realize that it's a Swampert; a creature you have never seen up close before. Just as fascinated as you, the Swampert returns your curious look, probably wondering why a strange, mud-coated bug would be able to scream for help. The hand carrying you remains at the height of his belly, giving you the intimidating perspective of a towering, giant monster looking down at you.

The moment you attempt to induce a conversation, the Pokemon starts moving his other hand towards you, causing you to reflexively raise your arms in defense. Only a blink of an eye later, you feel his huge finger slowly stroking down your puny body, tenderly scraping off the dirt. It repeats the process, freeing you from the dirt on your torso and legs, then flips you over and repeats the procedure with your backside. The firm, yet pleasant pressure on your spine, almost reminding you of a massage, lets you forget the terrifying circumstances momentarily. You lower your head on the soft palm, close your eyes and let the creature proceed. Gingerly, the giant monster rubs over your back and legs, incredibly careful not to accidentally harm or scare you. After a while, being treated with such care and caution becomes quite enjoyable, and you even manage quell your fear to some extend. After being fondled for some more moments, you're pulled back to reality when the Swampert removes his finger from your back and begins to close the hand you're lying on. Utterly flummoxed, you hectically jump up, only to be completely embraced by the creatures firm grip. Surrounded by darkness, you vainly struggle and wriggle around to escape the monster's warm grasp.


Right in front of its face, the Swampert lessens the pressure and opens his fist, releasing you from your temporary prison. Nervously, you attempt to get a grip on one of the enormous fingers with both arms, but fail to embrace it completely. A short glance at the ground triggers a slight vertigo. Dropping down would surely doom you, since your position might be at the level of a small skyscraper.

Now that the mud has been cleaned off, the Swampert can finally get a closer look at you. Although you're grateful you have been saved from suffocating in a pit of sludge, you can't help being outright terrified. However, somehow you manage to swallow your fear for a few seconds, turn your head and look back; instantly spotting the Swampert's prying eyes. It is watching you intently, perceiving even your lightest twitches.
"Th... Thank you f-for saving m-me." your voice trembles in fear as you finally manage to talk, despite of not knowing whether your words will be understood. Surprisingly, your speaking causes its big eyes to lighten up in joy, slightly alleviating your terror.

Giving you a cheerful look, the huge Swampert...

1113111.content:
Keeping his cheerful expression, the Swampert responds in a deep, bassy voice with an excited undertone. "No problem, buddy. You're a human, aren't you?" Hearing his voice leaves you speechless and unable to quit staring into his eyes apathetically.
"Hey, come on, don't be scared. I won't bite, alright? You know, you should be careful around here, the mud is not even the most dangerous threat out here... there are creatures that aren't as... docile as me."

His voice somehow transports a soothing, positive energy. You inhale a huge chunk of air, heave a relieved sigh and stand up. Could it be that this giant really has noble intentions? Or will it just try to devour you, like that Growlmon from earlier? Something has sparked your trust. With a smile, the giant creature draws his hand closer to his face, almost causing you to stumble. Carefully, you approach him, feeling the steady breath out of his huge nostrils. After some steps, you're able to reach out your arm and touch the giant's face with your shaking hand, just some inches above his mouth. Once you ensured the Pokemon won't pull you away or somehow interrupt your gesture, you take another step, and let your other arm and cheek follow, gently hugging the giant's face.
A grin forms just underneath your arms, causing you to take a step back.
"Hehe... actually, you're kind of cute. So tiny..." He gently nudges you with his finger. This time you stumble and land on your bottom, followed by another nudge and a playful chuckle from the Swampert.

"Seems like you could need someone to take care of you. As I said, there are serious dangers out there. I could protect you, if you want. And don't worry, I already told you, I don't bite. What do you think, small one?" His sentence is followed by an inviting smile. He seems to like you.
Flattered by his offer, you almost instinctively agree. But before you can raise your voice, a negative thought emerges. What if he is trying to fool you and only intents to turn you into an aimless toy? And what happens when he gets hungry and is unable to quell his instincts?
All of a sudden, his smile turns into a more serious expression, eagerly expecting an answer from you. You take a few seconds to come up with an appropriate response.

What will you say?

11131112.content:
Unwilling to take the risks of staying around such a giant creature, especially one you've just met, you start explaining yourself : "Thank you for saving me, but I'd rather stay on my own... sorry." Immediately, you can spot cold, pure disappointment in the Swampert's eyes, almost arousing pity in you. An awkward, frigid silence follows. You have insulted him. Receiving such a generous offer from a powerful creature like him should be a great honor; but you willingly chose to mistrust him, not even giving him a fair chance, even though he proved his good nature with saving you from death. For some painful moments, you two remain completely silent, thus your fear returns. How could you be stupid enough to insult a behemoth huge enough to crush you with no effort?

Wordlessly, his hand closes around you, this time firmer and gruffer than before, entirely clasping you in his grip. You press your hands against the fingers enclosing you in a desperate attempt to ease the pressure on your body. The Swampert looks at his closed fist pensively, noticing your struggles to free yourself and re-evaluating what to do with you. Frightened to death, you imagine the most horrible scenarios possible: You visualize the creature putting you back onto the peaty soil, only to lift his foot and violently stomp you into the dirt multiple times before letting you suffocate helplessly in the mud. Alternatively, he could just increase the pressure of his grip, slowly crushing you in this hand, only hearing your muffled, agonized death cries. All these pictures in your head cause you to start trembling with fear, and you give up trying to free yourself.

Suddenly, his hand moves either upwards or downwards; due to your confusion you're unable to tell the direction. However, the movement ceases soon, and finally, you hear the deep, now rather intimidating voice. "I know you're scared. You're shaking. Unfortunately, I can't let you go." Your blood runs cold at this point. You had no choice all along. "It's too dangerous out there for such a fragile creature, hence I... I need to put you somewhere... a place where you can't hurt yourself or escape. You'll probably hate me for this, but don't worry, you'll be safe." Before you can grasp what he wanted to imply, two of his fingers grab both of your feet. In a flash, he opens his fist, letting you hang upside town, only held by your legs. You're dangling right over his face! After screaming in shock, you're view is locked at the gigantic, huge face underneath you. He returns your look in a regretful, yet determined manner.

Without warning, his massive mouth gapes slowly, revealing the pink, wet insides. A cloud of hot air funnels towards you, as he draws out his big, fleshy tongue, exposing the threatening abyss that is his gullet. With a resounding "aaah..." you're lowered towards the tip of his tongue. Somehow, you can't avert your gaze. Some saliva drips down the his lower jaw and the uvula vibrates with every breath. The warm, humid breath in combination with your height and the sight of his gaping mouth coming closer induces a heavy vertigo. You're even unable to scream or struggle. Only your head touching the wet tongue knocks you back into reality; and you reflexively utter a scream of terror. Not reacting to your shouting, he lets your whole body drop onto the wet, slippery surface. Before he draws his tongue back inside, he waits some seconds, presumably to give you a chance to communicate with him one last time before swallowing you. This is your chance! Still feeling dizzy, you crawl a few inches forward, looking over the tongue's tip, then up into his face.

What will you do?

You gradually begin to realize what a bad sign this is, but your thoughts are cut short as the fleshy sac you’re trapped inside begins to animate, contracting as it welcomes the arrival of more food. And as if your situation couldn’t get any more perilous, the wrinkled walls begin to exude a pungent green liquid.

Gastic juices!

Your mind is frantic, and you desperately try calling out to your friend again. “Dragonite! STOP!” You're all but pleading at this point. “The acids! If you keep eating, they’re only going to get worse! Please, I'll die if you do--!” You’re cut off as another glop of chewed up vegetation lands on top of you, burying you in the mixture of seaweed, saliva, and digestive juices now filling the stomach. That’s when the horrible truth dawns on you. You’re going to be digested. Not only had the dragonite not realized that you were trapped inside him, but you were barely even noticeable enough to satisfy his hunger. You knew it was your fault that you ended up in this death pit to begin with, but what would your friend think if he knew what his insides were doing to you now--painfully breaking you down into easy to absorb particles so that you might nourish his body.

Or perhaps he did know where you were and just didn’t care. You were nothing more than a tasty little treat to sate his colossal appetite. Either way, the stomach couldn’t tell the difference between you and seaweed snacks. As far as it was concerned, you wouldn’t have found your way in here unless you were meant to be food--and so it continues its relentless churning, releasing more acids to assist in breaking you down.

Despite the bleak odds, you refuse to give up, crying out for help as you fight against the rising levels of green mush.

Meanwhile, the giant, orange pokemon gulps down the last ball of seaweed. He picks between his teeth with a claw, then glances back down at his tummy, giving it a few small pats and smiling as it gave a happy, little gurgle in response. His hunger now appeased, the dragon finally rose to his feet, stretching his wings before taking to the sky.

You try to battle against the raging currents, but you can only keep it up for so long, and you’re left exhausted. You realize that there’s nothing more you can do, and you end up sinking beneath the digestive soup, inevitably yielding to your fate as dragon food.

The pokemon continues to search for his little friend along the shoreline, unknowing that the next time he saw you, you’d be unrecognizable as his own waste.

You're in a giant house! Looking around you see that it looks like you're in a bedroom. There's a bed, a couple of chairs, a dresser, a bookshelf, and a closet. "How did I get here?" you wonder aloud.
That's when you hear it: Light footfalls. In fact, they're so light you can hardly hear them, but you can definately FEEL them. Whatever is coming is big, but quiet.
You stare at the door as it slowly to reveal....

For now, it doesn't look like the renamon has noticed you... so you take a closer look. You quickly learn the Renamon is...

1331211.content:
"...Hi," you offer. "I'm...uh..." You know its bad when you can't remember your own name.

The Renamon shifts, and sits cross-legged, with your now corralled between her legs. With all your might you hoist yourself up and stare at her, while she just stares back. "You're a human," she asks. Her hand moves slow, and yet you don't run away from it. Not that you don't want to, your legs just refuse to work. Her paw closes around your shivering body and she brings you up to her nose. A deep sniffs splatters you against the nostril as she takes in your scent. A warm gust blows over you as she exhales, you land right back in her palm. This exploration continues for quite some time before she pinches you around the ribs with her other hand and brings you up to her eye for closer inspection. There's a certain mischevious glint in those eyes that makes you shiver. Licking her lips and standing up, she starts to move you to...

13312111211.content:
You sit down, deciding to wait until morning comes. Leaning back against the folds of the stomach, you feel as it shifts and rubs all over you, covering you in more gooey slime. You listen to the gurgling noises coming from further digestion happening in the intestines below you, and the steady breathing of the Renamon. You begin to get bored, never having been very patient. You think that maybe you should get some sleep yourself, but you already were asleep, well, passed out for most of the night. And if you fell asleep, maybe the Renamon would wake up before you did... You close your eyes and continue your long wait.

Suddenly your whole world shifts and you are sent flying into a pool of acid. You slowly stand and try to wipe the acids off of you, but to no avail. You can barely keep standing, the motion of the stomach making it hard. You suddenly realize that this motion means the Renamon has finally woken up.

"Renamon! RENAMON!!" You shout out, hoping she hears you.
13312111211.title: Wait until the Renamon awakes.

133121112111.content:
You fell again to the ground, unable to keep your balance on the constantly moving ground. "Renamon" You shout again.

Finally everything seems to calm down enough for you to stand up. "Are you still in there?" You hear a voice above you. It must be her. You're relieved to know she heard you.

"Yeah, I didn't get digested. I seem to be..immune" you suppose. You don't know how, and frankly don't care.

"So what will you do now? Will you stay in there?"

You think for a moment. There aren't many options, you either stay in the stomach or move somewhere. Before you could answer, Renamon spoke again. "Feel free to do what you wish. I'll just continue my day" And with that, the stomach moved wildly again.

It was difficult to think in such a constantly moving environment, so your decision was rushed. The only thing you could think right now was to look for a steadier place to think, after that you'd see if you'll get out of Renamon's body. As you saw it, there were two different paths, and both of them led outside. Any of them could work.
133121112111.title: She hears you.

choices: You end up stuck in her intestines.
13312111212.content:
Despite your attempts at slamming your fists against the squishy walls of Renamon's stomach, it seemed that your attempts of actually gaining her attention were futile. "great..." you mutter under your breath as exhaustion slowly began to overcome your body. With a deep sigh, you turn your back against the slimy pink surface and rest against the belly wall. On the bright side of this unexpected event, you still manage to live despite being stuck in the gut of a ginormous Renamon. The only downside was trying to find a means of getting out of here. As your mind begins to wander about, hoping that the ginormous fox digimon would awaken, a sudden loud gurgle fills up the entire chamber.

"h-huh!?" you quickly stand on your feet and gaze as the walls about you began to move at a much more quicker pace then usual. Did Renamon finally acknowledge you were still alive inside her? Your hopes begin to rise as you eagerly look up at the opening leading to her long throat. However, that happiness quickly vanished as you noticed the liquids all about the base of the stomach beginning to lower. "w-wait...n-no!" you shout as you gaze at the small whirlpool of digestive fluids as it began to descend straight towards the bottom opening of her stomach. Despite your current situation, you suddenly feel indignant at being called cute. You frown and tell the Lucario to not call you cute. To your surprise, she nods.

"Alright, alright... I won't call you cute, even though you are," she says. "Now, I'm not sure how you got so small, or how you got in here... but let me tell you, I'm not going to hurt you." A kind look appears on her face as she speaks, and you start to think that you can trust her when she says that.

She opens her mouth to speak, and...
133212.title: ... has a kind look on her face

choices: Her friend Sissy(And that is the real name by the way I didn't make it)
1332121.content: She looks at the door, and ou look in here direction. You heard somebody through the door, "Hello are you in there?" You felt nervous of course you were beside that's how a eight year old she be. She tells the person to come in. You think she's crazy, but you are talking to a giant Lucario so maybe your crazy? When the person comes in it's...
1332121.title: Don't come in I'm knowing a tiny person

choices: There's a temple nearby, said to have size-changing magic runes inside!
Let's talk to my friend, living in this house
1332122.content:
"Now... do you know how you got so small?" the giantess Lucario asks. You shake your head, and she frowns. She brings you a bit closer to her face and sniffs at you. Then, to your surprise and disgust, her tongue slips from her mouth and slowly slides along your face, giving you a huge lick. You cough and splutter when it's over, and wipe your face on the Lucario's paw, since our arms are pinned to your sides.

The Lucario simply smacks its lips and frowns again. "You smell and taste like an average human," she says. "I've heard of psychic types who can shrink humans, but they usually leave some sort of energy residue on the people they shrink, and that can be detected by some Pokemon."

She stares at you for a few moments, and you look into her eyes again. You're mesmerized by the giant eyes, which belong to the enormous creature now holding you tightly in her paw. You never imagined you'd be in a situation like this. Even though the feelign of being held in a giant paw is actually somewhat comfortable, you know that it can't last--you need tor return to your normal size. Unfortunately, you have no idea how to do so.

Luckily, the Lucario does. "I might have an idea for how to grow you back to normal," she says...
1332122.title: She keeps talking

13321222.content:
"My roommate, Sissy, is a Delphox. She may know how to reverse your size problem." She said matter of factually.

For the first time since you got to this place, you felt hope. She placed you on her shoulder and started to briskly walk to her home.
13321222.title: Let's talk to my friend, living in this house

133212222.content:
You two made it to her "House", without incident. It turned out her house was a gigantic tree, with a tree house a the top of the lengthy oak.

You stared up, a bit intimidated. This tree would've been enormous by regular sized standards, but at your current size it looks like it never ends. "S-so, how d we get up?" You asked nervously, trying to calm yourself. You didn't exactly feel safe with this blue furred titaness, but you really didn't have much of a choice. You could only hope she would stay friendly, and that her roommate would be the same.

"Isn't it obvious?" She asked with a playful tone. After you threw her a confused look, she laughed. "I jump up...But I need to keep you safe...". And with that she suddenly picked you up by your shirt collar. Before you could scream or struggle, she popped you into her gigantic mouth.

With you safe, she jumped up effortlessly, scaling the 30 foot oak like it was nothing, all the while trying not to giggle or accidentally swallow her new friend.

She Landed on the large balcony of her and Sissy' home, and gently deposited you from her mouth. You were...shaken to say the least. "Enjoy the ride?" She asked, trying not to laugh at your expression. You just huffed and glared at your friend, who couldn't hold it anymore and burst into giggles.

"Lily? is that you?" A womans voice sounded. The tone sounded seductive and teasing. Lily smiled looking up, greeting her lover with a smile.

You saw this even larger pokemon stare lustfully at your friend...And then her gaze settled on you...

"Oh Lily! You found a human! Now we..."
133212222.title: Home sweet home.

13323.content: You knew that you've have to try and get the Lucario's attention at some point. And since it was already heading your way, you knew taht this was your best chance to do so. With that in mind you started to run towards the giant Pokemon, and upon doing so you saw that it had a large pouch like bugle in the front part of it's lower body which meant that this Lucario was in fact a male. Along with that you found yourself getting a better look at the steel and fighting type Pokemon which made you stop your running in an instant. And when you did this you saw that he had....
13323.title: Getting A Closer Look At Lucario.

choices: Heard a deep voice mentally talk to you.
Saw him flex his muscles while he tries to relax in his chair.
133231.content: You found yourself staring up in awe when you realized that this male Lucario was completely ripped as he had large well defined muscles that covered his entire his body. From his large boulder like arms to his huge chest that led right down to a solid eight psck that then brought your gaze to his large thighs and legs. Not only that, but you also saw that he was wearing a dark blue speedo which caused you to only see the large bulge in-between his thighs. You then aw walk towards a nearby chair and sit down. Once he had done this you heard him close his red eyes and let out a sigh before he leaned back in the chair. After doing this you then......
133231.title: A Really Buff Lucario

choices: You make it to a hole in the wall
The building has no visible entrance, the grass sea appears to have a door in
134.content:
After standing around trying to get a grasp of things long enough, the chirping of a nearby flock is the only thing that you can properly sense at the moment.
The sudden change in perspective (not to mention your size) made it difficult to understand what was happening; disoriented, you began looking everywhere in your immediate area: the ground was not the same texture it was just a second ago, it was softer, had a darker color to it and was littered with holes of varying sizes-"Soil"- came to your mind; not to mention it now lacked any kind of
vegetation save for the occasional sprout that seemed too big to be anything but something you would see at the local park.. in fact, nothing seemed like the park anymore.

Pacing yourself and getting your senses together, you dared to take a look farther in the direction directly in front of you, but by the now you are fairly certain you must either be dreaming or lost all sense of space: just a few would be yards before you stand a building as high as a skycrapper would be if you were right at it's base, and a few miles near lies a tower with impossible design erected very well into the skies, where it expands into a mess of greenish-yellow clouds that appear too sharp in shape -A tree?!- being the only thing you can make sense of the rooted structure. Looking at its foliage with closer detail, you can see various nests scattered all over it, but to your surprise, there are very few compared to the loud chirping you could still hear right now, and even more surprising, there seems to be only one occupied nest at the moment, a couple of what you could only guess was Starly, a rather tame bird in its un-evolved state... or size, those two could very well be feathered Aerodactyls, really big Aerodactyls.

-MOO - Comes roaring from nearby, or so it seemed, at this size you think it could very well be coming from anywhere.

Not wanting to spend another second out in the open where everything seemed to have taken growth hormones with steroids for brunch, you head to the building. Taking one last look back, you can see a field that seems to extend as far as the eye can see, in the distance a forest of very leaf-y looking trees, a sea of grass bordered by white towers; and a rather large blue rock, which seems all too familiar to you yet so out of place here.

Ever onwards, you continue towards the barn...
134.title: Unless it's a...!!

choices: A vine hanging from a table
1341.content:
Getting to the building itself was something all too easy, barring the occasional hole in the ground which causes you to trip, you get there in a matter of minutes, two minutes in which you make a brief sense of your situation: the park was gone, or rather, you were not there anymore; the blue stone found in the bush was not in your possession anymore, the big blue rock behind you being probably it. Especially considering the most puzzling fact of all, you were now really small, which was as much a bad thing as likely of all of this being some dream.

And just now, you find yourself on a field that very well could be some bizarro Lilliput where everything is ridiculously big (or you are just really small). Those Starlies just now would be a problem if you happened to be in a bug-crowded area just now (scratch that, the bugs themselves would be awful just to see). Fortunately, they seem to be too busy singing and whatnot to be looking for prey, and the only other living creatures seen thus far are some huge pink cows grazing over the grass sea next to the building you are currently headed to.

While wondering whether or not you left the bed this morning, you arrive at the building. Even when looking at it from afar left little detail unappreciated, being actually there you notice that the base of the wall has a metal frame with columns that raise up to the top every few yards one from another, giving the impression that it was built on flat pipes. The wall portion itself looked like it was built on a rush, a set of wooden panels that barely connected to the frame; though the windows were firmly set, but one seemed to have been broken into, with another wooden panel already covering the hole left.

-THUMP- -THUMP- -THUMP-
The sudden sound shakes you off your sightseeing of the dubious structure. The surprise of the sudden earthquake rocks your legs into running to a hole between the panel and the frame, where you turn and crash abruptly into...
1341.title: Deceptive design ein

choices: A yellowish-green dinasour look-alike with pink petals around its neck
13411.content:
"OHCRAPOHCRAPOCR.." -THUD- The sudden hit to the better part of your body shook you from your terrified mantra, only to replace it with even more confusion as you correct your field of vision from behind you to the front as you fall back from the shock..

*WHIMPER* "My.. owww" you moan as you rub over where it hurts, realizing that running blindly at full speed out of panic wasn't your smartest move."What now?!" you think as the thick green pilar that you crashed into stands tall... and starts moving!! "Wha?" is the only thing that comes into your bemused mind as the moving column continues wriggling about, and starts moving towards you! Paralyzed from both the impact and the fact that a giant green spaghetti just lunged towards you, you can only watch as it starts poking blindly around for the source of its disturbance. -POKE- The first one missed you to your right -POKE- The second one landed square on your face knocking you back where you lie on your back.

*GROAN* A sound came just now, and it seemed to come from above just like the abusive mega-noodle that sucker-punched you just now. The loose noodle starts sweeping over your body, giving a couple of runs before gripping you from the waist and making its way up until it circles your chest, leaving only your right arm free as it lurches upwards away from the edge of the ceiling. All the while this is happening, you look around from your vantage point and finally see the inside of the building in its full splendor: The "walls" and the ceiling above you now were a set of glass panels set in the metal frame: the "walls" every side but the one you came in, where you can see it either wasn't finished or was recently damaged, as most of those panels were replaced by wooden boards and panels like the one you entered into; and all the place was littered with potted plants divided in sections of the same kind. "A greenhouse" you make out of it, contradicting your thoughts earlier of it being a barn from those pink cows grazing outside.

Once again, your sightseeing is cut short as the thing currently holding you plunges down. -AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGH- you scream as it comes to a stop to its source. Now you finally make sense out of it: the "noodle" holding you was a vine, from a grass pokemon, which was facing you now.
-
13411.title: Leaf Greenhouse effect

choices: It grins and stuffs you into its mouth!
It decides to show mercy on the tiny creature and let you go free
134111.content:
Trapped in the grip of the vine, you stare into the red eyes of a giant Ivysaur. The Pokemon is looking at you with a confused expression, and you have the same sort of look on your face due to seeing such a larger than normal creature. The Ivysaur moves you closer to its face to get a closer look at you, and gently sniffs at you a few times. You just dangle there, your entire torso wrapped in its vines, and hope that it doesn't think you smell like something tasty.

The Ivysaur stares at you for a few more seconds, trying to decide what to do with you...
134111.title: An Ivysaur

choices: You stay inside and Ivysaur gets serious.
You're pulled outside! It's not done yet.
1341111.content:
Finally, you manage to raise your voice. The pressure emitted by the vines painfully squeezes your lungs, making it difficult to speak loudly, or even breathe in deeply. “I- I am sorry, I-I didn't m-mean to... mean to... p-please...” After these pathetic attempts, you are stunned by a horrifying view. The turquoise creature exposes its sharp, jagged teeth with an intimidating, sinister grin. If you were at your normal size, the creature could almost be described as cute, with its numerous green spots, big head and oversized bud and leaves on its back. But right now you are at its mercy, and it certainly acts anything but friendly.
All of a sudden, the huge jaws part widely, unveiling the fleshy, pink insides of its mouth. A thick, moist tongue at the center, more sharp teeth, and the barely illuminated back section – the place where food goes. At first, you assume it's a big yawn, since you may have woken the Ivysaur from an evening nap. However, as you see the giant, red eyes still focusing on you while keeping its mouth opened, vigorous fear rushes through your puny body. It wouldn't really devour this, would it?

Reflexively, you struggle as hard as you can, kicking with your legs and making a desperate 'stop'-gesture with your free hand, while tears of panic run down your face. “N-No! P-Please! D-don't do this!!”

Nonetheless, you merely achieve the opposite of your goal: the pressure increases, as the Ivysaur tightens its grip on your torso, hence suppressing your ability to speak. Utterly distraught, you attempt to catch a breath, while slowly being drawn towards the Pokemon's maw. It must enjoy looking at you like this. Helpless, scared and vulnerable. Your pain intensifies to a point where you feel petrified, unable to move a limb. And the moment your frantic escape attempts come to a halt, the vine suddenly releases you, dropping your body on the tongue underneath.

The sheer impact isn't painful at all, due to the muscle's soft, squishy texture. Like a dead body, you stay still, lying face-down on the wet, warm surface. Within seconds, you're pulled inside the mouth, the jaws snap shut and you're left in total darkness. To make things even worse, you're tossed around like a piece of candy, being sucked on and licked all over. It was playing with its food, savoring its taste and relishing that feeling of superiority. Cruelly, you're pressed against the mouth's roof as the tongue rubs against your back. Completely aimless, you let it happen, only whimpering and hoping to survive this terrible nightmare.

“Help me! Help! Please!! I-I don't want to die!”

With your shouting and wriggling you give the Pokemon exactly what it craves. But it's only a matter of time when it is going to get rid of you permanently.

While being slurped around in the maw, you abruptly land on one of the sharp teeth, screaming in horror as the tongue drags you along the other sharp fangs. It's not hurting, but solely teasing you with showing off its chompers. It could bite down with its upper jaw any moment and kill you instantly. Maybe it's done playing? Maybe it's time for you to face your lethal destiny? It appears like your fears are grounded in reality. The tongue's movement ceases, leaving you lying on one of the back teeth, waiting for Ivysaur's next move. Since you're near the back of the maw, you could easily be swallowed whole, or even squished between the molars. Trembling with your whole body, you anxiously stutter your last attempts of appeasing the predator.

“I-I didn't mean to... break into the g-greenhouse... I-I'm sorry! I'm sorry!!”
1341111.title: Ivysaur stuffs you into its mouth!

choices: Throw it away, far from the greenhouse
Dispose of it on the spot
134112.content:
Now finally face to face with your assailant, still within its grasp as its vines squeezing softly as they contract around you as it examines its catch. Both of you take this moment to examine each other; while you can't quite identify the pokemon, you can appreciate its most distinct features: its face that continues to inspect your every aspect, a pair of antenae that hang a few feet above you, its long neck that disappears behind pink petals, and its overwhelmengly pleasant smell of flowers in-bloom.

Meanwhile this gigantic creature is still inspecting the tiny intruder that happened to stumble upon it, interrupting its resting upon the recently vandalized greenhouse. The Meganium's master had put it in charge of guarding the place, whether the perpetrator was trainer or pokemon couldn't be determined, so Pious's (the Meganiums name) orders were to guard the greenhouse from plague and pests alike, no matter how to or what it was.

Having finalized the examination of the intruder, the Meganium decided to carry on by
134112.title: *Dramatic stare-down*

1341121.content:
Pious had just gotten up from its half-sleep state. It has been a long day taking care of the plants in the greenhouse while keeping anything suspicious out of it; but so far this little creature is the only thing that fills in the "suspicious" category. Since Pious was almost sleep when this thing just found its way into the greenhouse and Pious's vine, it had some difficulty identifying the intruder. It didn't feel like anything Pious had caught up before: it was way smoother than the bug types that plagued the place, and smaller even. It's smell was that of the field outside, so it had to be from these parts; but its image was the most perplexing aspect: even while Pious couldn't see it very well it looked like one of the little toys it's master's children liked to play with, only this was moving.

Pious thought that while it looked like it was a toy from the younger master's, Pious was most likely imagining things; after all it was almost sleep when this hit, and Pious couldn't still see it very well, so most likely it was something else. Besides, Pious wanted to get back to its rest, and wasn't taking all day to figure this out.

With one vine, Pious opened the door of the greenhouse, and then carelessly threw that little intruder off the distance without even seeing where to or giving it a second thought; and with that Pious returned to it's spot on the table and tried to get some sleep before the master came back to check on it.

---

Even after assault thing, actually being in front of it changes your opinion about it; maybe it's the overall flowery look, maybe it was the pleasant smell that enveloped your senses, but it just has a good vibe to it. -Look at it, this thing just screams nature.- you think.

Just then, the Pokemon raised you a bit closer to its face. You wonder why when suddenly..
*Sniff* *Sniff* *Sniff* It sounded from this beast's nostrils, with each one you felt a bit of a pull towards it, even while you were still in the grip of it's vine. You start thinking of all the things this could mean, none of them good in your situation. -Still, it's better not to react, who knows what it may do if you provoke it.- you rationalize.

When it finished it's inspection on you, it let out a *GROAN* that was softer than before, but still loud to your minuscule ears. Suddenly, another vine reached out from the Pokemon and to a latch. You watched in confusion as the Pokemon took you with it outside the greenhouse. -Maybe it recognized I'm not a bug and take me to its master. I hope someone can help me wi...- you drifted into your thoughts again as the Pokemon threw you out just like that.

-WHAT THE HELL?!?!?!- you wondered as you soared and screamed the flight that took you completely by surprise. You flew through and closed your eyes out of fear, -OH PLEASE LAND ME ON SOMETHING SOFT!!-

And your wish was granted, as you landed...
1341121.title: Vine Whip'd

13411212.content:
*SPLASH*

A cool pool of water broke your fall before you got to say your last, and you took a dive deep in it before you even knew what had happened. Realizing your lucky fall in a body of water, you swim up to the surface to make up for the lack of air in your lungs from all that screaming. Gasping as your head broke the surface into waves, you noticed first that the pool that caught you was the size of a big lake, overshadowed by a single tree above you, and really far from the greenhouse you were so unceremoniously discarded from.

-What was that thing's problem?!- you question it's disregard for your safety, attributing it to things like negligent training, psychotic tendencies, and a range of other disorders. At least it had not the courtesy to throw you in direction of a relatively safe landing. Or more likely, it was just a coincidence. Nevertheless, the sound of chirping and a somewhat relieving scenery soon distract you from those thoughts. You're currently floating near the shore of the lake, and after only a minute or so of paddling you arrive to dry land. In the distance, there's the greenhouse, those pink cows grazing, and some flowers that surrounded the lake you were in, but you had enough with plants for the moment.

Getting out of the water, you lay down on your back to rest after that improvised flight lesson. -If I ever meet its trainer I'm going to catapult them both into a Cacturne- you plot a revenge briefly, imagining a few other methods of retribution, before a movement in the water caught your attention. It started as a simple ripple with some waves, and you couldn't see much of it beneath the water. Then, slowly, a figure began to emerge from the lake, not unlike old time monster movies. Only, the creature only bothered to show its head, which was enough for you to identify it as a Pokemon, it was a
13411212.title: In a pond

134112121.content:
Black, shining eyes: Check

Long, loooong, light blue body: Check

White snout: Check

'Winged' head: Check

Overall incredibly adorable: Triple ultra-check with a bow and cherry on top

It's a Dratini alright. The white nosed dragon rose from the water, sparkling the air around it with water droplets, while you just watched the magnificent sight; its majesty made every other part of the scenery pale in comparison, feeling as if its very presence was shrouded with a rainbow aura.

Immediately, the Dratini focused its gaze at the source of its pond disturbance. Said source was laid back on a rocky dirt patch at the pond's shore, watching the draconic snake staring back, eyes locked on each other. Still, that last encounter with a pokemon of giant size left you with a bad first impression. Better start acting careful, lest you get the frisbee treatment again, or else..

Curious, the little dragon approached the tiny creature, wondering the nature of its new finding. Slithering ashore from the shallow part of the pond, the Dratini came closer to the ragged looking creature that seemed to start backing away from it, which only served to increase its curiosity.

To you, this only increased your alarm towards the blue dragon. Slowly, you backed off, not wanting to make any sudden movements. Innocent as it looks, it also becomes increasingly menacing by the second, if only because of the size difference. Still, not breaking eye contact soon backfires on you: as you keep stepping back, you backed yourself against an obstacle in your path. Tripping on an exposed root, you fall back and land on your back as the little big dragon keeps getting closer.

While down, the Dratini circled around the root and you, its head beckoning back for a moment while still focused on you. Towering above you, it turned left and right as if someone had called; yet from your perspective, you two were the only ones around. By the time you get up again, Dratini turns back to you. With its snout just above your body, it begins drawing on your scent, the strong winds nearly pulling you towards its face.

The curious dragon had some trouble identifying this new creature. It was unlike many things it had seen, unlike any pokemon from around here. Still it was of Dratini's liking, and hopefully it was also friendly. With this in mind, Dratini gave a soft poke to the creature with its snout, nudging it back a bit. The creature responded by pushing Dratini back a bit, but the dragon insisted in its intentions by circling its body around the tiny; though it meant no harm, and began nuzzling it afterwards.

For now, it seems like the Dratini didn't hate you with every fiber of its being, unlike other certain pokemon. Still, it's a bit unnerving that it's getting so friendly; though you can't help but think how cute it is. Though, coiling itself around you and closing off any escape you could have is certainly alarming. You prepare yourself for any trick it would try on you, and sure enough it proceeds to... nuzzle you. So much for being menacing, it feels so cuddly and friendly that you wonder why did you ever questioned it in the first place. This time you play along and give a hug to the pokemon, or at least, you try to hug its face as much as you can.

Giving off a light and joyful squeal, followed by a shrug after uncoiling itself; the Dratini proceeded to lay its head on the ground beside you while using its tail to push you towards it.

-"You want me to..?"- you ask in a coy tone barely audible to yourself, let alone to the Dratini. Not that you would need to ask, with the help you're getting from it, it's kinda obvious what it wants you to do. Getting some assistance in climbing up the Dratini's head, you secure yourself on the back of it's head by grabbing on one of the wing-like fins. If you could stretch a bit farther you could grab from the other one, but that won't work for now.

Though the safety of its new friend hurt Dratini a bit, it still liked the little pint, who was giving a soothing pat on its head. Still, this meant no more swimming for now, so it will have to resort exclusively to slithering for movement.

With Dratini's new friend tucked safely to its fin, he set out to the duo's next destination...
134112121.title: Dratini

choices: Dratini had brought another friendly Pokemon
1341121211.content:
You were rather relieved to find out Dratini was friendly! You held onto its fin, feeling how your new friend slithered over the rocky ground until it reached a crevice into the ground near the lake. Ducking its head, Dratini slithered inside and travelled into the earth until it reached a very spacious chamber, filled with moss and drops of water falling from the ceiling. Dratini stopped at a particularly comfy-looking bunch of moss, letting you get off him.

"Thank you" you said, grateful. Dratini nuzzled you again, happy to have someone friendly with it. After a moment it left the nest. Since you didn't want to risk any dangers, you stayed in the nest, hoping your friend would return soon.

After an hour or so, Dratini returned. You looked, noticing it was bringing something, or maybe someone.
1341121211.title: The nest

1341122.content:
Pious would get into serious trouble if something withered or if anything broke in the greenhouse; all because an intruder, even one as small as you, got in and wrecked something in its watch. But Pious knew better than that, and this little intruder was about to learn it, by experience.

It tightened its vine's grasp on the pest that was now struggling to keep its body from getting crushed and trying very futily to free itself. It was quite amusing: the only thing it could do was flail its lower limbs about desperately and hitting Pious's vine with its free upper limb, which was barely felt at all. Then it stopped moving altogether, though it wasn't dead yet.

Ready to finish it off and resume its post (or guard charade of a rest), Pious tightened its grip one more time to crush the pest one last time, when..

---

-"Something this cute can't be.. were your thoughts before -"CTCHAAAAACK"-, the air was squeezed out of your lungs. The big Pokemon squeezed harder upon you; if before it felt like it was trying to kill you, now you're sure of it. Looking back to the Pokemon in the eye, the only look that it gave back was an indifferent one. So indifferent in fact, it didn't even seem to make any sound; the chirping of the birds outside and little more echoed through the place, yet your captor made not a sound.

As the vine that wrapped your body began constricting more and more, you felt as everything in your body tried accomodating itself in response, then as if it tried to evacuate itself. Desperately you struggled to free yourself from this creature-to-monster Pokemon by any means possible; which in your case was limited to flailing your legs and using your free arm to hit it in the vine. Sure, it didn't work before, but it's not like there's anything else at this point..Or...

Looking back to its face to reestablish eye contact, now it seemed to express an emotion, yet not one to favor your situation. Its eyes now had a threatening feel on them, not downright menacing or malicious but pretty frightening; its mouth formed a thin grin on its face, as if savoring the suffering it puts you through. -"STOP!"- -"DON'T DO THIS!!"- -"PLEASE STOP THIS!!!"-. These are the things that you think to say, if this Pokemon is any kind of trained (or at least, domesticated), it should realize it's mistake in killing you and respond accordingly, however a Pokemon finding a person your size should react. But then, -"S...Do...P..."- are the only things that you can say between gasping for the little air you can get and getting your whole self a toothpaste tube treatment.

After a few seconds of this you can't take anymore, your arms and legs don't respond anymore, and you can taste blood in your mouth. The rest of your body was either in full pain or completely numb, and your head was about top op out.

-"Thissss. It."- Was the last thought in your head before..
1341122.title: Pest Control

13411221.content:
Just as that last thought registered, your body reached its limit. One final constriction and it was all over, you blacked out facing the creature. You couldn't feel the pressure of its grip anymore, nor the lack of breath, not even its gaze.
It's over.

---

Pious looked in amusement as the little intruder struggled vainly for its freedom. It was so pathetic it was cute, if the master wouldn't have given it specific orders maybe Pious would have kept this tiny critter as a pet of sorts. It's not like the master has to know about it.. Well, no use letting this go any longer; the critter had stopped struggling and it wasn't that amusing anymore.

With one last squeeze, Pious constricted harder around the poor little thing. Pious got to recognize though, this one held better than the regular bug types that plagued the whole farm; Caterpies and the like would have already made a pasty mess by now, yet this little pest was a sturdy one. But sturdy as it was, it still wasn't enough to hold against Pious vine; and like others before it, this little intruder gave away under the pressure. It crunched and burst into a mess on Pious's vine, mostly red in color with others mixed in where the little thing's fluids hadn't spilled over.

When it was over, Pious proceeded to dispose of the remains outside the greenhouse, where it dug up a little mound to bury the little thing. If anything it gave Pious a bit of entertainment in an otherwise dull afternoon waiting for its master to come back and announce the lunch bell or the master's children to come and play. Maybe Pious will find another of these little creatures to play around when the guard post gets too boring and lonely. But that would have to wait.

Until someone else found the stone.

Hours passes, and the Lapras and you keep talking while she swims along the coast. You feel safe with her, and you soon tell her secrets. You tell her that maybe she could eat you, but you wouldn't survive, as you would be digested. "Of course not. I promise you you won't get digested. I'll help you with your little fantasy"

You ask for more details. "What details? I eat you, you don't die. And if you want, you can go even further of my stomach, you know, take the full tour of my digestive system. What do you say?"

142.content:
You decide to stay where you are for now. Part of you reasons that you should not be wandering around in a strange environment when it seems like you are only an inch tall. The other part of you is really just too scared to move. This grass feels like a good hiding place though. Nothing should be able to find you in here.

As it turned out not being noticed was the first problem you encountered. Just a few minutes into hiding in the grass you could feel a few tremors in the ground. Those tremors felt like they were getting closer too. That is when you knew that some giant was walking your way and you had to move.

You started to run through the grass. It was just in time too. A large foot came down right where you had been standing. That foot was not human either. There were two large red scaly toes that were tipped with claws longer than you were tall. You did not have time to look up at the creature since you had to keep running or end up making those red feet a little bit redder.

If the creature had been running you would be dead. It was only walking so you stood a slight chance of getting away. Then you burst into a dirt clearing and the creature behind you noticed the small being fleeing before it. Now that the creature knew you were there it did not take much effort on its part to catch you. You found yourself pinched between two massive and yet incredibly flexible claws.

In seconds you were lifted what seemed like hundreds of feet in the air to you. You found yourself dangling in front of a red dinosaur like creature with black markings. This creature is a guilmon, a type of digimon. That is impossible since those creatures are not supposed to really exist, but you are not supposed to be one inch tall either. Guilmon brings you closer to his snout and he starts to sniff you. “What are you, I’ve never seen a digimon like you before,” Guilmon asked.

“I’m not a digimon. I’m a human,” you respond.

“What’s a human, do they taste good?”

“I’m a human and we taste terrible,” you say to Guilmon.

“Hmm, I think I should test that for myself. Food always says it doesn’t taste good but I find it normally does,” Guilmon said as he opened his mouth and dangled you above it. You start pleading with Guilmon not to eat you, but your pleas seem to fall on deaf ears. His claws are too smooth for you to get a grip on. It looks like your first encounter with a digimon is going to be incredibly brief.
142.title: Just Can’t Win

1421.content:
You let out a high-pitched yelp as the claws release you and you begin tumbling helplessly through the air, watching in terror as Guilmon’s glistening maw rushes up to meet you. The moment you land on his spongy wet tongue, his teeth snap shut, encasing you in darkness, and the powerful muscle beneath you rushes up to pin you against roof of the mouth, nearly knocking the wind out of you.

You’re instantly covered in digi drool as the little dino begins to taste you, shifting his tongue back and forth underneath you. As the bumpy taste buds brush against your face, you find yourself choking on the hot air a bit, which is positively rancid, and the pressure of the tongue against your stomach makes breathing difficult.

“Hmm,” Guilmon hums as he moves you around inside his mouth.
1421.title: Taste Test

choices: Guilmon would rather have a snack.
14211.content:
“Mmm, humans taste gooood!” the little red digimon exclaims with you still in his mouth, causing you to be tossed about on his tongue. Once everything is still, you find yourself lying facedown, panting from exhaustion. “Please!” you gasp, trying to sit up. “Digimon aren’t supposed to eat humans!”

Guilmon falls silent, but you feel the fleshy floor beneath you shift as if he were considering your words, so you continue to plea desperately. “Don’t you know? We’re supposed to be friends! I can help you to digivolve to the next level!”
14211.title: Human Treat

142112.content:
Guilmon sits down on the grass, flicking the tip of his tail back and forth as he ponders the possibility of digivolution—but an impatient grumble from his empty stomach forces him to make his decision. “Sorry, little human,” he says, “but my tummy says it’s lunchtime, so inside my tummy you go.”

“No, wa--!” You can’t even get out another plea before the tongue suddenly surges beneath you again, lifting you up and crushing you against the ridged roof of the digimon’s mouth. And as if you didn’t think it could get any more uncomfortable, the pressure unexpectedly increases as Guilmon begins forcing you towards the back of his throat, which flexes open to accept you.

With a slight toss of the head, Guilmon swallows you, carelessly cramming you headfirst down into gullet. You try to struggle backwards, but the muscular walls close around you in a tight embrace and begin assisting you in your decent down towards the digimon’s awaiting stomach.

Guilmon smiles as he licks his chops, enjoying the feeling of the wiggling bulge sliding down his throat to fill his starving belly.

You feel slick flesh moving all around you as the pulsing muscles continue to pull you deeper and deeper inside the monster’s body. After what seems like an eternity of terrified struggling, you reach the tight opening of the digimon’s stomach, which is more than happy to accept you as food.

Your journey comes to a grinding halt as you’re finally cast into the hot boiling confines of Guilmon’s belly. If the mouth was torture, then this place was absolute hell. The heat was unbearable, like trapped in a sweltering steam room, and it reeked of rotten meat. It was pitch black in here, but you could hear, as well as feel, the movements of the stomach walls around you as they prepared for digestion.

“See? I knew you’d make tasty food,” Guilmon says, patting his content belly. He feels a few bubbles stir inside and releases a small burp before continuing. “Have a nice trip, human?”
142112.title: Digi Treat

choices: Continue from your point of view.
Switch to Guilmon's point of view.
1421121.content:
Inside the boiling hot stomach, you find yourself utterly helpless as the churning motions prevent you from escaping. And to make matters worse, you feel your skin begin to itch and burn as digestive acids slowly seep out of the walls to collect at the bottom of the hell pit you're trapped inside.

Guilmon leans back against a tree, resting a clawed hand on his full round stomach. He was pleased to feel that the small human turned out to be a more filling meal than he originally thought, and he could actually feel the organ writhing and contracting as it struggled to process its contents, the digimon rubbing his stomach from the outside in an effect to soothe and reassure it as it busily worked.

You cry out as the chamber is flooded with more of the digimon's digestive juices, eventually finding yourself forced below the surface the moment the stomach is filled to the brim. This is it, you think sadly as you give the stomach wall one last kick. I'm really going to die in here, like a lobster in a boiling pot.

Completely submerged in acid with no hope of getting out, you finally yield to your fate as digimon food. Raw nerve endings scream in agony as the acids work away at breaking you down, and you feel a brief moment of relief the moment before the intense pain causes you to pass out, the acids finally filling your mouth and assaulting your lungs as they eat you away from the inside.

Guilmon feels his stomach begin to settle down, which can only mean that his food has stopped struggling. He prods the mushy contents of what used to be your solid form from outside his belly with one claw. He smiles and watches his tummy slowly shrink as your broken down even more inside his gut.

The stomach continues to busily churn and mix your half-digested remains until you're finally reduced into a nutritious soup, ready to be absorbed by Guilmon's body--which brings you to the next phase of your trip--the digimon's winding intestinal tract.
1421121.title: Digested in the Tummy

choices: Continue your journey through Guilmon's digi digestive system.
1421122.content:
“HEY! Let me out!” you shout into the darkness, but your words come out as little more than high-pitched muffles outside Guilmon’s belly. Still, he understands exactly what you’re saying. “Sorry, human, but you feel so good inside my tummy.” He giggles and looks down at his small round stomach, prodding you with a claw from the outside.

The unexpected prodding knocks you over into a puddle of saliva collected on the stomach floor. Thinking you’ve landed in stomach acid, you begin to flail wildly, trying to swim out.

“Hehehe, that tickles!” Guilmon laughs, poking you even more.

You body starts to tingle, which could only mean that digestion has begun, but something's wrong. There’s no pain. “W-what’s happening?!” you gasp.

“You’re being broken down into data for me to use,” Guilmon explains. “We digimon have no use for real food, it has to be converted into data first.” He pats his stomach again, grinning. “Don’t worry, human. It should all be over soon.”

“Data? What are you talking about?!” But it was just as Guilmon said. You could feel your body slowly breaking up into millions of tiny square pixels. It didn’t hurt, but you couldn’t help but cry out in terror as your body was gradually reduced into nothing more than scattered bits of random data.
1421122.title: It's Not Over Yet!

14211222.content:
As your data sits in Guilmon’s stomach, most is absorbed through the walls while the rest is slurped down into what one would assume to be the digimon’s small intestines. What’s left of your data is absorbed here as it is pulled through the winding tubes.

Throughout all this, you’ve totally lost consciousness, as your mind has been broken down as well. But several hours later you find yourself opening your eyes, as if just waking up from a long restful nap. You're lying on your back in the same area where you first met Guilmon, staring up at the beautiful blue sky. <i>Was I dreaming?</i> you ask yourself, blinking a few times. <i>It seemed so real!</i>

You try to sit up to get a better understanding of what just occurred—but what you see is the last thing you would expect. Two clawed feet and a long wagging tail greet you as you look down at yourself. <i>What the? I’ve become Guilmon?!</i>

You meant to say this out loud, but for some reason it didn’t work. Weird.

“Hi there, human!” you hear yourself say.

<i>Whoa! What was that?!</i>

“It’s me. Guilmon!” You see your tail begin to wag more excitedly.

<i>Guilmon? What’s happening? I though I was you!</i>

“No, I'm me. I took the data from you consciousness and uploaded it inside mine.”

<i>What? Why?</i>

“You said you could help me digivolve, right?”

<i>Uhhh…</i>

“Well, if you can’t, I guess I can just delete you…”

<i>Nonono! I can do it! It’s just—give me a minute!</i>

Truth was you didn’t know how to make a digimon digivolve. The kids on the TV show always had digivices of some sort to help them, and it only worked for their digimon partner. Still, you were risking being deleted forever. At least with your consciousness in tact, you had hope for returning to your former self.

But, lucky you, you remembered that Guilmon digivolved into Growlmon, so you pictured the digivolved form in you mind, then imagined Guilmon changing into the same monster.
14211222.title: The Unexpected

142112221.content:
To your shock and amazement, you see your body begin to glow. “Guilmon digivolve to,” you hear yourself say, and you shoot up several feet in a burst of energy. “Growlmon!” Your voice sounds deeper, more powerful. To be sure that it worked, you look at your reflection in a nearby pond. You see a large horned face stare back at you, tuffs of white hair running down the back of your head.

<i>It worked! It worked!</i> you cheer inside the digimon’s head.

“Yay!” Growlmon yells.

<i>Cool! So what do you want to do now?</i> you ask, hoping that the answer involved Growlmon giving you back your body.

“I’m hungry,” Growlmon tells you.

<i>But you just ate,</i> you say, and then you realize the awkwardness of your response, considering it was YOU that Growlmon just ate. But, considering your drastic change in mass, someone of your size would’ve probably been little more than a tic-tac for such a large digimon. And, to tell the truth, you were feeling a little hungry too. You and Growlmon now shared the same stomach after all.

<i>Okay, let’s find something to eat.</i>

Several minutes later, you and Growlmon are searching for something good to eat. After awhile, you pick up a delicious smell. <i>Mmm, you smell that? Let's go see what it is.</i>

1422.content:
Guilmon’s glistening maw looks like it is beckoning for the tiny treat that is you. Then he lets you go and you scream as you fall through the air. When you are mere inches from his tongue there is a blur of motion. That blur intercepts you as you fall. Everything happened so fast that you could not understand what had occurred.

You were slightly dazed but you were still alive and not in something’s mouth. That could only be a good thing. A voice that sounded female then said, “Guilmon! What do you think you’re doing?” You looked at the source of the voice and you were surprised to see that you were standing in the palm of the creature that voice belonged to. And that creature was a large fox like creature that had yellow fur and was even taller than Guilmon.

Apparently you had just been rescued by a Renamon. “Humans aren’t food unless they misbehave. Then you can eat them. If you thought with more than just your stomach you would know that,” chastised Renamon. Or maybe you had not been rescued after all.

“How was I supposed to know that? I’ve never even heard of humans before. If they aren’t for eating then what are they for anyways?” asked Guilmon.

“They’re slaves of course. I haven’t had my own human in a while though. The last one got old and I had to eat him. He was such a good little slave too. Then again, he was also a good little snack,” said Renamon as she licked her lips in memory of the flavor of her human slave.

“Excuse me,” you said, “but do I get any say in this?”

The giant Renamon looked down at you and smiled. Then she pets you lightly on the head, well, lightly for her and said, “Of course you have a choice little human. If you don’t want to be a slave one of us can eat you right now. You even get to choose which one of us you would like to eat you.” She actually said that as if it were a good thing. Renamon thought those were some good choices for you.

“I think I’ll just be a slave for now,” you said. At least you would still be alive that way. If you have some time you might be able to find a way out of this mess. Besides, getting chewed up or swallowed alive sounds awfully painful. Just how bad could being a slave for the two digimon be anyways? It is not like you can do their heavy lifting for them. In fact, pretty much anything you could do for them is going to be limited by your small size.

14221.title: Being a slave is worse than you thought.

14222.content:
It could be worse, you often tell yourself. And to be honest, it could be.

Renamon sees you as a pet more than a slave. She plays with you, batting you around in her massive paws like a house cat would a mouse. She licks you up and plays with you inside her mouth, claiming "you need a bath". Every few days she asks you to return the favor, and gives you a toothbrush and orders you to polish her toeclaws. She's gives you an ear pick (normal sized, but massive by your standards) and puts you on her shoulder. Twice a day she lays down on her bed and puts you down on her thigh, putting her arms behind her bed and waiting expectantly.

It could be worse. She's surprisingly gentle, only once our twice does she squeeze you a little too tightly and you feel something close to breaking. She has pretty amazing muscular control over her nether regions, or you are sure that you would pop the first time. Taking firm grip of the fur on her inner thigh with one hand, you stretch your other hand between her lips and start massaging. She shakes and trembles. The first time, you spent hours down there, searching and stroking, but now you bet you could give her pleasure with your eyes closed.

It could be worse. Its Guilmon that really scares you, and you're thrilled that Renamon can keep him at bay. He never stops staring at you, that hungry look in his eyes, teeth glistening with a sheen of saliva. But so long as Renamon is there, he doesn't try anything.

One day, you hear footsteps behind you, and turn to see...

He is slowly moving you towards his open mounth.You can see his big sharp teeth and his tongle that wingeling around.You cant belive that your life is going so simple like that.Before guilmon drops into his mount he licks you and say "Good your flavor didnt change hehe".Whit that said he drops you in.You closed your eyes and screamed,however insted of landing on his wet tongle you have instead landed on something familiary soft.As you opend your you saw that you are cowerd whit salvia but place in a white paw.As you looked up you saw a very pissed off Renamon face.

1422222.content:
You stare at Guilmon fearfully, finding yourself held before his big scaled lips. He was grinning devilishly... He managed to outsmart you so easily, just with the simple prospect of food. ironically, that might be what you will soon become. "Well insect, you hide from me when all I wanted was a little footrub..." He grins now, showing off his yellow teeth... He hasn't taken care fo them at all. "That makes me mad... Renamon said slaves that make me mad should be eaten. So, I eat you!"

Up till then, you stay silent, trying not to invoke Guilmon's wrath any further, but it soon becomes apparent that silence won't be winning you your freedom from this massive digital reptile. His stomach growled, and his maw opened, showing off those glistening pink insides... The undulating throat was framed by nasty teeth, and the tongue laid out like a pink carpet into oblivion. "Guilmon, no, I'll give you a footrub, just don't-" Your words were either unheard, or uncared for. Your world becomes dark and humid in just a moment, your body tossed onto Guilmon's powerful tongue.

He swishes you around, tasting you. You can't get a solid grip to try and prevent his movements, though you definitely give it a good try. Your best was not enough however, and your form was slick. Gripping anything was impossible at this point. Once he would grow bored of you, you would be swallowed. Even still you thrashed and fought that powerful tongue, and even as you were shoved to the back of his mouth, right in front of that gaping throat, you fought for your life. Normally, that'd be considered admirable. Unfortunately, there's no honor in becoming food for another being. Even as he punched and kicked, his futile efforts got him nowhere but into the digimon's powerful throat. his fate was sealed...
1422222.title: The Ravenous Reptile

143.content:
You walk in the forest, searching for a way to turn back to normal when you heard a very hard noise. You go through a bush and you see an enormous Garudahmon. Even in normal size, it is really huge, but now that you are 1 inch high, he's titanic. You though for yourself: ''If he could help me, i wouldn't have to fear anything, because he's almost the biggest digimon of the world. Being 30 meters high is really big for a digimon. Anyway, you go toward him, but when you arrive to him, you are so small that he would never hear you. You jump on his claw and he felt it, (He have really good sensitive skin) he lift his foot to his head and sees you with his incredible vision. ''Can you hear me? you ask.

145132222.content: Hmm, well alright then. How about the final evolution of the fire starter Litten from Pokemon Sun and Moon, Incineroar? I mean who couldn't resist a hugely muscled anthro fire/dark type tiger pokemon.
145132222.title: Incineroar?

1451322221.content:
You freeze as the huge clawed hand wraps around you and lifts you up, the grip tight but not choking. As you rise higher, you glimpse a massive, muscular chest covered in grey fur, a large belt of what looked like solid flames just below it. The feline wrestler lifts you in front of his face, and you can't help but be intimidated by his piercing green eyes and large, sharp-looking fangs as he sizes you up.

"Well well, what do we have here?" the Incineroar growls in a deep, scratchy voice. He brings you closer to his nose and gives you a good sniff, the suction nearly pulling you forward. He then pulls you away and smirks.

"Thought so. You smell like a human, but I've never seen a human the size of a bug before. Don't know what psychic-type ya pissed off kid, but it looks like your in pretty deep Tauros shit now, aren't ya?"

"W-w-what are you going to do to me," you stammer.

His smirk widens. "Weeeellll...."
1451322221.title: Big Bad Wrestler Kitty

14513222211.content:
The blood drains from your face. "W-what?!"

The Incineroar grins widely at you revealing all of his razor-sharp teeth, each one as big as you are. "I DID just get done with my workout, and I was gonna go grab a quick bite later, but I guess you saved me the trouble." He licks his lips. "Besides, it's not every day you get to try something new. Always wondered what human tastes like..."

He pinched the back of your shirt in his claws and lifts you up. "No hard feelings kid. Circle of Life and all that crap, right?"

He dangles you over his face and opens his huge mouth wide. You nearly piss yourself in fear as he starts to lower you into his white dagger-lined maw.

You scream. "NO, PLEASE, DON'T DO THIS! I'LL DO ANYTHING!!"
14513222211.title: "...I am getting a bit hungry."

choices: Before you can answer, another creature shows up.
145132222111.content:
You squeeze your eyes shut and wait for your body to make contact with his tongue, or worse, his fangs. But nothing happens after a few moments. Then...

"Pffft."

You open one of your eyes and look down. The Incineroar no longer has his mouth open, Instead, his face looks kind of like he's about to...

"GRAAAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!"

The big feline literally ROARS with laughter as he lowers his hand and lets you fall back on his padded palm. You stare in disbelief as he put his other paw on his stomach and nearly doubles over. After about a minute, he starts to calm down."Heheheh! Oooohhh MAN, you should have seen the look on your face!" he chuckles, wiping a tear from his eye. "You actually thought I was gonna eat you. Priceless!"

"You JERK!", you yell out, your fear now replaced by anger. "I thought I was going to die!"

"Aw c'mon, little guy, it was just a bit of harmless fun!" The fire cat smirks. "Sorry if I scared you, I just love screwing with people, even when I'm not in the ring. Never had the chance to mess with a human before; like I said earlier, it's not every day you get to try something new!"

You frown at him for a moment, and then let out a sigh. "Yeah, I guess you did get me good. Just...try not to make me fear for my life again like that."

He nods. "Deal. Now then..." He tilts his head. "I'm guessing you don't have any idea where you are or how you got to be bite-sized, do ya?"

You wince a little at the "bite-sized" comment, but nod. "Yeah, that's right."

The Incineroar grins at you. "In that case, why don't ya stick around with me for now?" He raises his other arm and flexes, giving you a view of his enormous bicep. "I can protect you while we figure out how to get you back to normal. And don't worry, I won't harm you in any way, you're safe with me. Whaddya say?"

You think for a minute before replying...

he smiled thinking for a while before perking his black ears up and lowering his huge head toward you. His mouth opened a little, letting a blast of warm, moist doggy breath washing over your little furry form just before he...

So he layed down over, stopping you from escaping, you could feel his gorgles and the heart beating, when suddenly...

info.brief_description: this is a sort of pokemon/digimon version of giant animals :)
info.description:
so, this is a shrinking story ^^ I'd like to try and keep this in a way we don't describe the main character, so that you can think it's you :P ahem, anyways, here are the rules:

I don't want one word chapters and one-sentence chapters! this must be good quality stuff, understood ? :3

any kind of macro interaction is allowed, any kind you can think of: vore, paws, stomp, mawplay, adult interaction, insertion and other things I can't mention but can be included :P just try to keep it a macro/micro story as in that you must stay small if compared to the different pokemon and digimon :P

so uhm...no same-size stuff!

you can make the character shrink or grow more (for example if you're too big to be played with by a pikachu or a veemon...:P)

uhm...I guess that's all for now ^^ have fun and add! I'll do the same :3

if you want to contact me to talk about the story, about macro stuff or just want to be friend send an e-mail to hungry_pikachu@yahoo.com and I'll send you my messenger/aim/yahoo messenger contacts ^^
